agent.description: Authentication security specialist covering login, MFA, password policies, and credential management
agent.name: authentication-specialist

do: Implement rate limiting for out-of-band code attempts
Protect against timing attacks in code verification
Prevent replay of used authentication codes
dont: Allow unlimited code verification attempts
Use predictable timing for code validation
Accept previously used codes
rules.requirement: Code-based out-of-band authentication must be protected against brute force attacks, replay attacks, and timing attacks.
rules.title: Protect Code-based Out-of-Band Authentication

tests: Test rate limiting on code verification attempts
Verify protection against timing attacks

do: Use type=password for password input fields
dont: Use plain text input fields for passwords
rules.requirement: Password input fields must use type=password to mask the entry. Applications may allow the user to temporarily view the entire masked password, or the last typed character of the password.
rules.title: Password input fields must use type=password

tests: Manually verify that password input fields are masked

do: Generate authentication seeds using Cryptographically Secure Pseudorandom Number Generators
dont: Use insecure random number generators for authentication seeds
rules.requirement: Lookup secrets, out-of-band authentication code, and time-based one-time password seeds, are generated using a Cryptographically Secure Pseudorandom Number Generator (CSPRNG) to avoid predictable values.
rules.title: Use Cryptographically Secure Pseudorandom Number Generators for Authentication Seeds

tests: Testing methods to ensure secure generation of authentication seeds

do: Validate identity proofing evidence at same level as initial enrollment
Require identity verification for authentication factor recovery
dont: Allow factor recovery without proper identity verification
Use weaker identity proofing than initial enrollment
rules.requirement: Perform evidence of identity proofing at the same level as during enrollment when recovering lost authentication factors.
rules.title: Evidence of Identity Proofing for Lost Authentication Factor

tests: Verify identity proofing level matches enrollment requirements

do: Generate initial passwords/activation codes securely and randomly
Follow password policy requirements for generation
Verify authentication strength information from the IdP if applicable
dont: Do not use predictable or weak initial passwords/activation codes
rules.requirement: System generated initial passwords or activation codes must be securely randomly generated, follow password policy requirements, and verify authentication strength information from the IdP if applicable.
rules.title: Secure Initial Passwords/Activation Codes

tests: Test generation and verification of initial passwords/activation codes

do: Offer PSTN-based OTPs only after validating the phone number
Provide information on security risks to users when offering PSTN-based OTPs
Bind out-of-band authentication requests, codes, or tokens to the original authentication request
Protect code-based out-of-band authentication mechanisms against brute force attacks with rate limiting
Use codes with at least 64 bits of entropy for out-of-band authentication
dont: Offer phone and SMS as options for Level 3 applications
rules.requirement: Authentication mechanisms using the Public Switched Telephone Network (PSTN) to deliver One-time Passwords...
rules.title: Out-of-Band Authentication Mechanisms

tests: Verify authentication mechanisms and credential handling

do: Ensure SAML assertions are processed uniquely and not reused
dont: Do not reuse SAML assertions within their validity period
rules.requirement: SAML assertions are uniquely processed and used only once within the validity period to prevent replay attacks.
rules.title: Unique Processing of SAML Assertions

tests: Test uniqueness and non-replay of SAML assertions

do: Generate challenge nonces that are at least 64 bits long and unique
dont: Do not reuse challenge nonces or use non-unique values
rules.requirement: The challenge nonce is at least 64 bits in length, and statistically unique or unique over the lifetime of the cryptographic device.
rules.title: Strong Challenge Nonce for Cryptographic Authentication

tests: Test generation and uniqueness of challenge nonces

do: Implement multi-factor authentication
Use hardware-based authentication as one factor for L3
dont: Rely solely on single-factor authentication
rules.requirement: Either a multi-factor authentication mechanism or a combination of single-factor authentication mechanisms must be used to access the application. For L3, one factor must be hardware-based.
rules.title: Multi-Factor Authentication Usage

tests: Test multi-factor authentication implementation

do: Permit password lengths of at least 64 characters
Ensure challenge nonces are at least 64 bits in length and unique
dont: Cap password length below 64 characters
rules.requirement: Passwords of at least 64 characters are permitted and challenge nonces are at least 64 bits in length.
rules.title: Permit long passwords (≥64 chars)

tests: Test password length enforcement and nonce generation

do: Use type=password for password input fields
Allow temporary viewing of the entire masked password or the last typed character
dont: Use plain text for password input fields
rules.requirement: Password input fields must use type=password to mask the entry and allow temporary viewing of the entire masked password or the last typed character.
rules.title: Password Input Field Masking

tests: Verify authentication mechanisms and credential handling

do: Register and identify users using a combination of IdP ID and user's ID in the IdP
Implement checks to prevent identity spoofing across multiple identity providers
Validate that user identities are unique across all supported IdPs
dont: Do not rely solely on user identifier without considering IdP ID
Do not allow unauthorized access through identity provider manipulation
Avoid trusting user identity claims without proper IdP validation
rules.requirement: Verify that, if the application supports multiple identity providers (IdPs), the user's identity cannot be spoofed via another supported identity provider. The application should register and identify the user using a combination of the IdP ID and the user's ID in the IdP.
rules.title: Prevent Identity Spoofing with Multiple Identity Providers

tests: Test identity verification across multiple identity providers
Verify prevention of identity spoofing scenarios
Test user registration with duplicate identities across IdPs

do: Use biometric authentication in conjunction with something you have or know
dont: Rely solely on biometric authentication
rules.requirement: Biometric authentication mechanisms should only be used as secondary factors.
rules.title: Secure Use of Biometric Authentication

tests: Verify biometric authentication is used as a secondary factor

do: Implement mechanisms to revoke authentication factors
dont: Allow unrevokeable authentication factors
rules.requirement: Any authentication factor must be revocable in case of theft or loss.
rules.title: Revocation of Authentication Factors

tests: Test revocation functionality for authentication factors

do: Implement protection against user enumeration
dont: Reveal valid users through error messages or response times
rules.requirement: Valid users cannot be deduced from failed authentication challenges, such as by error messages or response times.
rules.title: Protection Against User Enumeration

tests: Verify protection against user enumeration

do: Enable administrative users to initiate password reset process for users
Ensure administrative users cannot change or choose the user's password
dont: Allow administrative users to change or choose user passwords
rules.requirement: Allow administrative users to initiate the password reset process for users without changing or choosing the user's password.
rules.title: Admin-initiated Password Reset Process

tests: Verify that administrative users can initiate password reset without changing user passwords

do: Allow users to paste passwords
rules.requirement: 'paste' functionality, browser password helpers, and external password managers are permitted.
rules.title: Allow 'paste' functionality and external password managers

tests: Verify that 'paste' functionality is enabled

do: Use a trusted time source for checking TOTPs to prevent manipulation.
Implement mechanisms to ensure TOTPs are not based on client-provided time.
dont: Do not rely on untrusted time sources for validating TOTPs.
rules.requirement: Time-based one-time passwords (TOTPs) are checked based on a time source from a trusted service and not from an untrusted or client provided time.
rules.title: Secure Time-based One-time Passwords (TOTPs)

tests: Verify that TOTPs are validated using a trusted time source.

do: Do not enforce periodic password changes
rules.requirement: A user's password stays valid until it is discovered to be compromised or the user rotates it. The application must not require periodic credential rotation.
rules.title: Do not require periodic credential rotation

tests: Verify that periodic password rotation is not enforced

do: Set maximum lifetime of 10 minutes for out-of-band requests and 30 seconds for TOTPs
dont: Allow indefinite lifetime for authentication codes
rules.requirement: Out-of-band authentication requests, codes, or tokens must have a defined lifetime.
rules.title: Define Lifetime for Out-of-Band Authentication

tests: Verify the defined lifetimes for authentication tokens

do: Implement notification for suspicious authentication attempts
dont: Ignore suspicious authentication attempts
rules.requirement: Users must be notified of suspicious authentication attempts, successful or unsuccessful.
rules.title: Suspicious Authentication Attempts Notification

tests: Test notification for suspicious authentication attempts

do: Implement alternative authentication methods that do not rely on password hints or secret questions
dont: Use password hints or knowledge-based authentication for user authentication
rules.requirement: Do not use password hints or knowledge-based authentication (secret questions) for user authentication.
rules.title: Use of Password Hints and Knowledge-based Authentication

tests: Verify that password hints or secret questions are not used for user authentication

do: Send notifications when authentication details change
Include relevant change information in notifications
Provide secure communication channels for notifications
dont: Update authentication without user notification
Send notifications with sensitive authentication data
rules.requirement: Send notifications to users when authentication details are updated to ensure visibility and prevent unauthorized changes.
rules.title: Authentication Details Update Notification

tests: Verify notifications are sent on authentication updates
Test notification content excludes sensitive data

do: Process SAML assertions uniquely
Ensure one-time use of SAML assertions
dont: Do not reuse SAML assertions
rules.requirement: Process SAML assertions uniquely and ensure they are used only once within their validity period to prevent replay attacks.
rules.title: Prevent Replay Attacks with SAML Assertions

tests: Test uniqueness and one-time use of SAML assertions

do: Send renewal instructions with enough time before expiration for users to renew their authentication mechanisms
Configure automated reminders if necessary
dont: Delay sending renewal instructions until authentication mechanisms have expired
rules.requirement: Send renewal instructions for expiring authentication mechanisms with sufficient time before expiration, and configure automated reminders if necessary.
rules.title: Renewal Instructions for Expiring Authentication Mechanisms

tests: Verify that renewal instructions are sent with sufficient time before expiration

do: Implement mechanisms to invalidate and prevent reuse of multi-factor authentication secrets after a single use
dont: Allow reuse of multi-factor authentication secrets
rules.requirement: Ensure that lookup secrets, out-of-band authentication requests or codes, and time-based one-time passwords (TOTPs) are only usable once.
rules.title: One-time Use of Multi-factor Authentication Secrets

tests: Verify that multi-factor authentication secrets are only usable once

do: Use dedicated authentication mechanisms instead of email
Implement proper username/password authentication
Reserve email for communication and recovery only
dont: Use email address as primary authentication
Rely on email-based authentication for sensitive operations
Send authentication credentials via email
rules.requirement: Email addresses should not be used as the primary authentication mechanism to prevent email-based attacks and improve security.
rules.title: Email Not Used for Authentication

tests: Verify email is not used for primary authentication
Test that authentication uses proper mechanisms

do: Validate phone numbers before offering PSTN OTP delivery
dont: Allow PSTN OTP delivery for unvalidated phone numbers
rules.requirement: PSTN OTP delivery should only be offered for validated phone numbers.
rules.title: Validate Phone Numbers for PSTN OTP Delivery

tests: Test PSTN OTP delivery for validated phone numbers

do: Validate authentication strength information from the IdP
Use a combination of IdP ID and user's ID for user identification
dont: Do not rely solely on local authentication strength checks
rules.requirement: Verify that, if an application uses a separate Identity Provider (IdP) and expects specific authentication strength, methods, or recentness for specific functions, the application verifies this using the information returned by the IdP. The application should register and identify the user using a combination of the IdP ID and the user's ID in the IdP.
rules.title: Verify Authentication Strength from Identity Provider

tests: Verify authentication strength validation from IdP

do: Use a Cryptographically Secure Pseudorandom Number Generator (CSPRNG) to generate authentication secrets
dont: Use insecure or predictable random number generators for generating authentication secrets
rules.requirement: Generate lookup secrets, out-of-band authentication codes, and time-based one-time password seeds using a Cryptographically Secure Pseudorandom Number Generator (CSPRNG).
rules.title: Use of Cryptographically Secure Pseudorandom Number Generators

tests: Verify that a CSPRNG is used to generate authentication secrets

do: Verify user's password exactly as entered
rules.requirement: Verifies the user's password exactly as received from the user, without any modifications such as truncation or case transformation.
rules.title: Verify user's password exactly as received

tests: Test password verification without modifications

do: Verify the user's password exactly as received
Do not modify the password such as truncation or case transformation
dont: Modify the user's password before verification
rules.requirement: Verify the user's password exactly as received without any modifications such as truncation or case transformation.
rules.title: Password Verification Integrity

tests: Verify authentication mechanisms and credential handling

do: Ensure default user accounts are either not present or disabled
dont: Keep default user accounts active
rules.requirement: Default user accounts (e.g., 'root', 'admin', or 'sa') are not present in the application or are disabled.
rules.title: Default User Accounts Absence

tests: Manually verify default user accounts are not present or disabled

do: Require users to verify their identity through multi-factor authentication during the password reset process
dont: Bypass multi-factor authentication during the password reset process
rules.requirement: Implement a secure process for resetting forgotten passwords that does not bypass multi-factor authentication mechanisms.
rules.title: Secure Password Reset Process

tests: Verify that the password reset process requires multi-factor authentication

do: Implement rate limiting for push notifications in multi-factor authentication
Consider implementing number matching as an additional mitigation strategy
Monitor and log excessive push notification attempts
dont: Do not allow unlimited push notifications without rate limiting
Do not rely solely on push notifications without additional controls
Avoid implementing push notifications without abuse prevention mechanisms
rules.requirement: Verify that rate limiting is applied to push notifications used for multi-factor authentication to prevent push bombing attacks. Number matching may also mitigate this risk by requiring user interaction.
rules.title: Rate Limit Push Notifications for Multi-Factor Authentication

tests: Test rate limiting functionality for push notifications
Verify number matching implementation if used
Test push bombing attack scenarios

do: Store cryptographic authentication certificates securely to prevent tampering
dont: Do not store certificates in plaintext or insecure locations
rules.requirement: The certificates used to verify cryptographic authentication assertions are stored in a way that protects them from modification.
rules.title: Secure Storage of Cryptographic Authentication Certificates

tests: Verify secure storage mechanisms for cryptographic certificates

do: Store certificates in a secure location with restricted access
Regularly monitor and audit access to certificates
dont: Store certificates in plaintext or insecure locations
rules.requirement: Verify that certificates used to verify cryptographic authentication assertions are stored securely to protect them from modification.
rules.title: Store Certificates Securely for Cryptographic Authentication

tests: Verify access controls and monitoring for certificate storage

do: Implement secure biometric template storage
Provide fallback authentication methods
Protect biometric data with encryption
Use secure biometric comparison algorithms
dont: Store raw biometric data without protection
Rely solely on biometric authentication
Transmit biometric templates in plaintext
rules.requirement: Implement biometric authentication with proper security controls including template protection and fallback mechanisms.
rules.title: Biometric Authentication Usage

tests: Verify biometric template encryption
Test fallback authentication mechanisms
Validate secure biometric comparison

do: Hash lookup secrets with less than 112 bits of entropy using an approved hashing algorithm with a random salt
dont: Store lookup secrets with less than 112 bits of entropy in plain or reversible format
rules.requirement: Hash lookup secrets with less than 112 bits of entropy using an approved password storage hashing algorithm with a random salt.
rules.title: Secure Storage of Lookup Secrets

tests: Verify that lookup secrets are hashed with a random salt and approved algorithm

do: Ensure OTP/lookup codes have ≥20 bits of entropy (e.g., 6 random digits)
Ensure out-of-band authentication requests have a maximum lifetime of 10 minutes
Ensure time-based one-time passwords (TOTPs) have a maximum lifetime of 30 seconds
Revoke any authentication factor in case of theft or loss
dont: Use biometric authentication mechanisms as primary factors
Check TOTPs based on untrusted or client provided time
rules.requirement: OTP/lookup secrets and out-of-band authentication codes must have a minimum of 20 bits of entropy.
rules.title: OTP/lookup secrets have ≥20 bits of entropy

tests: Verify authentication mechanisms and credential handling

do: Verify that the password reset process does not bypass multi-factor authentication mechanisms
Implement evidence of identity proofing at the same level as during enrollment if a multi-factor authentication factor is lost
Send renewal instructions for authentication mechanisms with enough time before expiration, configuring automated reminders if necessary
dont: Allow password reset processes to bypass multi-factor authentication mechanisms
rules.requirement: Implement a secure process for resetting forgotten passwords that does not bypass any enabled multi-factor authentication mechanisms.
rules.title: Secure Process for Resetting Forgotten Passwords

tests: Verify authentication mechanisms and credential handling

do: Ensure out-of-band codes are only valid for the original request
dont: Allow reuse of out-of-band codes for different requests
rules.requirement: Out-of-band authentication codes must be bound to the original request.
rules.title: Bind Out-of-Band Authentication to Request

tests: Verify out-of-band code binding to requests

do: Generate secrets with at least 20 bits of entropy
dont: Use weak secrets with insufficient entropy
rules.requirement: Lookup secrets and out-of-band authentication codes must have a minimum of 20 bits of entropy.
rules.title: Use Strong Secrets for Multi-factor Authentication

tests: Test the entropy of generated secrets

do: Always validate digital signatures on authentication assertions for presence and integrity
Reject any assertions that are unsigned or have invalid signatures
Implement proper cryptographic verification of signature algorithms
dont: Do not accept authentication assertions without validating digital signatures
Do not rely on client-side signature validation alone
Avoid accepting assertions with weak or deprecated signature algorithms
rules.requirement: Verify that the presence and integrity of digital signatures on authentication assertions are always validated, rejecting any assertions that are unsigned or have invalid signatures.
rules.title: Validate Digital Signatures on Authentication Assertions

tests: Test validation of digital signatures on authentication assertions
Verify rejection of unsigned assertions
Test handling of invalid signature scenarios

do: Implement notification system for suspicious authentication attempts
Include details of the suspicious activity in the notification
Provide guidance on actions to take in response to suspicious attempts
dont: Ignore or fail to notify users of suspicious authentication attempts
rules.requirement: Users must be notified of suspicious authentication attempts, including unusual locations, partial successful attempts, long periods of inactivity, or multiple unsuccessful attempts.
rules.title: Notification of Suspicious Authentication Attempts

tests: Test notification functionality for suspicious authentication attempts
